hackathon-description-text: Join the Girls in Tech, San Francisco chapter and Hackbright Academy as we innovate for social change for girls and women, by women. We’re tackling topics that deal with girls and women including (but not limited to) the following:
hackathon-eligibility: Any developer, designer, or entrepreneur eligible to enter the hackathon.
hackathon-requirements: Participants must create a prototype or MVP of a new product. The idea of the hack can be conceived previously however all code and work must be completed within the time limits of the event.
hackathon-rules:
We mean it. This is hackathon is meant to bring people together to create solutions for girls and women. We want you to work 
 with each other, be 
, and have the 
 time doing it. You should be learning new things and making friends throughout the weekend!  
As for code of conduct, we expect everyone to to adhere to this: https://hackcodeofconduct.org/

Build and demonstrate your idea through a functioning prototype. Your projects are 
required to be technical; however, development is part of the judging criteria.

Any code for the project must be entirely coded at the hackathon (you get over 24 hours to hack!). However, we do encourage use of publicly available frameworks/APIs and open-source code.

Any finalists will have their code audited by a developer appointed by Girls in Tech. Your code is yours, but we would like to see it if you are a finalist.

Use Git or an equivalent to track your code as you write it. If it comes down to an audit, it’ll help you prove your code is new.

Really push yourself to create something that is a viable solution to help girls and women - the possibilities are endless! You could do anything from helping women keep track of their menstrual cycle to creating an app to tackle sex trafficking.

You must pitch your product as what you’ve submitted to us! If you deviate from your submission, your pitch will not be considered during the judging process.

Each team will be limited to a size of 3-5 members. Every hacker is limited to working with one team to submit one project. We want to to see your best work and to dedicate your time on a single project.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each team member receives a Galaxy Tablet (up to 5)

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=221 Main St #1000, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA
hackathon-location-address: 221 Main St #1000, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA
hackathon-description-header: Women Uniting to Solve Global Challenges
